Articles.Content:
I read today (but I guess the news is a bit old) that Sony pictures plans to make a Robotech Franchise.

They already have director and productor.

When I was little, I love this series. I hate it the total lack of realism or logic in transformers or other cartoons of that time. The history and characters were also very complex, it was great.

![Robotech-635x321.jpg](http://www.metro951.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Robotech-635x321.jpg)

Movie news:

[http://www.forbes.com/sites/olliebarder/2015/04/29/james-wan-in-talks-to-direct-upcoming-robotech-movie/](http://www.forbes.com/sites/olliebarder/2015/04/29/james-wan-in-talks-to-direct-upcoming-robotech-movie/)

Not sure how much time until is finish, maybe 3 or 4 years at least. How else is feeling enthusiastic about this film?

![robotech12-700x357.jpg?resize=700%2C357](http://i0.wp.com/bitcast-a-sm.bitgravity.com/slashfilm/wp/wp-content/images/robotech12-700x357.jpg?resize=700%2C357)

This ought to be fun...

- - - Updated - - -

The article said "live action."

This might be strange, too.

Thanks for the link, I hadn't read that article. Which expresses concern that Macross original creator/designer Shoji Kawamori isn't named. Since Robotech is derived from Macross, with its own story, he technically doesn't *need* to be involved, but it "would be nice."

I'll add it to a list of hopes abandoned through the years, of seeing a live action movie. The franchise (to include the Macross original) is a complex licensing mess; It could sit in development for years. I won't get excited until I hear production is starting.
yeah, maybe is quite soon to cheer.
